author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3869, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1685711207}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
Not much gud I can say about this experience.
Shockingly worse than some older RTS games.
Really outdated and in need of some patching.
Also seems to be missing some retail features.
For zero reasons a build-in Reality Pump DRM.
Which is by itself a reason to avoid this game.
Overall I'd say this version was really pathetic.
Buying it currently in this state is just a waste.
And there are better alternatives you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963661848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 71774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3048, 'playtime_at_review': 13507, 'last_played': 1710902433}
review:
This game is amazing, even after a decade of existance. While not very appealing visually, the gameplay is fun and solid. The tanks operate off of an armor basis. As in all but the lightest vehicles cannot be harmed by small arms. Tanks with lighter armor will suffer much more damage from tank shells than a tank with heavy armor.

The amount of units surprised me, as there are almost a dozen different infantry squads, as well as almost two dozen tanks and armored vehicles for each side (excluding the French Resistance). You can also realistically build up your base of operations with MG nests, AT bunkers and more.

I sometimes question if the enemy AI are actually trying to kill me or just exploring and happen to find my base, but then again, it's very advanced for 2004.

Finally, you have the ability to call in aerial reconnaissance, a light bombing strike, or even carpet bombing. There's even stuctures and vehicles that can counter these strikes.

Overall, I still find that this game can fit well in modern games aside from the graphics.
Definately buy this if you have the spare cash.

okay i had issues at the start getting it working but it was due to a DEP setting on my pc

author: {'steamid': '76561198908464368', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1622285369}
review: This game is RTS unlike Secret Service. This game was very good RTS game. I don't know about the accuracy because I don't know that much about tanks even though I'm interested in WWII. I think this game is just like Blitzkrieg but only with tanks. I didn't have any bugs so I was able to enjoy the game without frustration. It's very good WWII game and I enjoyed it a lot. It just like your typical RTS games and you will definitly be satisfied with your purchase. From the two birthday gift I like this game more though I shouldn't be comparing RTS to FPS. Secret Service was no match for World War II Panzer Claws even though I enjoyed Secret Service. That means this game is a damn good game because I enjoyed Secret Service but I enjoyed this game even more. The gameplay, sounds, and graphics are all amazing. I don't think accuracy matters as much as the execution of the gameplay. I really had fun playing this game and I think about playing again during classes. I can't concentrate in school because I think about how I should attack the enemies and stuff. If you really like games, you should know what I'm talking about. So I highly recommend this game to any RTS fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086796541', 'num_games_owned': 705, 'num_reviews': 1291, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1613964986}
review:
**SPECIAL EVENT** This is my 666th review on steam! **SPECIAL EVENT!**

I had nothing planned for this. But here we are, my 666th review on steam! What an occasion! I wish I had something demonic to review but I didn't think ahead tbh, I just noticed how many reviews ive done so far. Luckily WAR IS HELL! So... close enough! lol. I will definitely have something saved for 777(probably a poker or card game of some kind) and my 1000th steam review. 

Now for the review of the game: Ahem, the tank is really slow but the explosions are really nice, lots of strategies to choose from and tactics to employ, like sending your troops out to do various things and calling them back to the tank. Music is what you would expect for a tank battle game. If you love tank battle RTS games you will love this one! Check it out on sale or if its in a bundle for everyone else. Final score: 6 slow moving tanks/666! lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198851588561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1610144223}
review: this game is quite old and it really shows. the menus are jankie and slow, the mechanics are very unique and not really in a good way unfortunately. the controls feel a bit like league of legends as in its an eagle eye view and top down type of game. me personally im not a big fan of these types of games. for what the game is the price i think needs to drop and while the game isn't expensive at all i still think the game isn't worth the price. i could barely sit through 20 minutes of this game till i started to get a headache. i get its old but its just simply not a good game even for the time it was released. the amount of amazing games that came out in the early 2000's is astonishing and this game just doesn't compete. im kinda glad i didn't pay for this it just simply isn't worth your time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198527279203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1701364984}
review:
This is highly underrated game! In this RTS game you can deploy your own units covering land and air, and also build units to defend the base or where else you want. Some tanks can be captured bc it has weak armor, others cant. It is very situational, and the game provides a good interpretation of the real warfare. 

The downside is that it is an old game, the resolution and movement is not very good, and AI also is stupid from time to time. But who cares? This is an old good simple game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2558, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1584721558}
review:
"World War II: Panzer Claws" ist ein RTS, ein Echtzeitstrategiespiel aus dem Jahre 2004.

Der Zweite Weltkrieg. Zwischen den Jahren 1941 und 1944 kÃ¶nnen wir zahlreiche Szenarien spielen und haben die Wahl zwischen gleich vier Kampagnen. Wir spielen entweder auf der Seite der Alliierten, der Roten Armee, der Wehrmacht oder der FranzÃ¶sischen Resistance. 

Genretypisch bewegen wir unsere Einheiten Ã¼ber abgegrenzte, meist quadratische Karten, geben Befehle und versuchen gegnerische Einheiten und Stellungen ausfindig machen und zu zerstÃ¶ren. Das funktioniert prinzipiell fÃ¼r einen in die Jahre gekommenen Titel auch ganz in Ordnung, wenn auch Einiges einfach nicht mit aktuellen Titeln mithalten kann. 

Aber die Grundlage, die "Earth 2150"-Engine arbeitet solide, die Missionen sind zahlreich und das Gameplay ist recht flott. GÃ¤nzlich Ã¼berzeugen kann es dennoch nicht, denn das Spiel nutzt nicht wirklich alle MÃ¶glichkeiten, die die Engine bieten wÃ¼rde. Vieles wirkt trotz der Vielfalt vereinfacht, runtergebrochen und simplifiziert. Das muÃŸ an sich noch nicht mal negativ sein, fÃ¼hrt aber hier dazu, daÃŸ sich doch viele Missionen arg Ã¤hnlich anfÃ¼hlen. 

Immerhin gibt es Tag- und Nachtszenarien, Wetter und unterschiedliche BodenverhÃ¤ltnisse. Auch sind die Einheitentypen zahlreich, sogar Bombern kÃ¶nnen wir konkrete Befehle geben.

Grafisch lockt der Titel beileibe keinen hinterm Ofen hervor. Die verwaschenen braungrÃ¼nen Texturen waren schon 2004 veraltet und nicht ansehnlich. Immerhin ist die Musik recht gelungen und die Soundeffekte sind fÃ¼r das Genre auch akzeptabel.

Alles in Allem ein Titel, der gerade noch so eine Empfehlung bekommt, dem man aber sein Alter deutlich ansieht und anfÃ¼hlt und der auch schon damals eher zum akzeptablen MittelmaÃŸ zu rechnen gewesen war. Eher etwas fÃ¼r Nostalgiker und Genrefreaks. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
6/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
6/10 Story
5/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
6/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Cancer Paws.

review: World War II: Panzer Claws Ã© um jogo de estratÃ©gia em tempo real onde vocÃª pode controlar o exÃ©rcito americano, russo ou alemÃ£o. Ã‰ um jogo bÃ¡sico de estratÃ©gia, com mecÃ¢nicas simples, cenÃ¡rios legais e grÃ¡ficos bem simples (mas para um jogo de 2004 ta valendo). DÃ¡ pra passar um bom tempo brincando, mas por ser um jogo sem conquistas, para mim acabou que perdi um pouco o interesse. O jogo possui um modo JxJ, mas nÃ£o cheguei a experimentar, mas sÃ³ deve adicionar mais diversÃ£o ao game. Na minha opiniÃ£o vale a pena se estiver em promoÃ§Ã£o ou para aqueles fÃ£s do gÃªnero. author: {'steamid': '76561198048038590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1576709898}
review:
Dieses Spiel nutzt die aus den 90ern stammende Earth 2150-Engine. Diese Engine muss man mÃ¶gen um dem Spiel Ã¼berhaupt eine Chance zu geben, da sie in dieser Zeit doch schon sehr angestaubt ist. StÃ¶rt einem die Engine nicht, so hat man auf den ersten Blick ein schÃ¶nes Strategiespiel. Jedoch nur auf den ersten Blick, denn es gibt so viele Punkte in diesem Spiel, die es meiner Meinung nach einfach kaputt machen.

Davon abgesehen, dass viele es nicht einmal starten kÃ¶nnen, denn ich habe es ohne Probleme auf meinem Win10-System mit einer Nvidia 1060 und einem 4k-Monitor spielen kÃ¶nnen, die schwarzen, fetten, Balken links und rechts stÃ¶rten nicht so extrem den SpielspaÃŸ.

Was aber sehr schnell den SpielspaÃŸ verdirbt sind die Infofenster, welche durchsichtig sind und mit einer braunen Schrift fÃ¼r Augenkrebs sorgen. Hinzu kommt eine KI die selten dÃ¤mlich ist, Fahrzeuge fahren munter auf den Feind weiter, nachdem man den SchieÃŸbefehl erteilt hat, obwohl sie locker schon in der Reichweite sind,..was zu ungewollten Kamikaze-Angriffen fÃ¼hrt. Die vom PC gesteuerte KI macht die selben Fehler und fÃ¤hrt mit Panzern gerne mal in eine gut verteidigte Panzerabwehrstellung,..was Ã¼brig bleibt ist Schall und Rauch. KI durchgefallen,..sitzen sechs!

Hinzu kommt fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich der fehlende Basisbau. Nur wenige Spiele haben mich bisher davon Ã¼berzeugt auch ohne Basisbau genial zu sein, ich bin halt ein Basismensch und liebe das Management von Ressourcen. Wem das nicht stÃ¶rt, der kann diesen Negativpunkt auÃŸer acht lassen.

Desweiteren ist die Soundengine nicht gerade unterhaltsam. Beim ersten Start musste ich das Spiel erneut starten, da der Sound nicht lief, beim zweiten mal klappte es dann. Die Musik ist Szenariotypisch und die Einheiten geben (jedoch sehr selten) mal eine Meldung ab, wenn man sie anklickt, oder wenn sie sich unter Beschuss befinden.

Das Szenario ist meiner Meinung nach kein Negativpunkt, auch wenn viele das 2. Weltkrieg-Szenario als ausgelutscht ansehen. Ich fahre gerne mit meinen Tigern spazieren.

Alles in allem wieder einmal eine mangelhafte Umsetzung der in den 90ern so schÃ¶n anzusehenden Earth 2150-Engine. Man hÃ¤tte mehr daraus machen kÃ¶nnen meiner Meinung nach, vor allem was die KI und das Sounddesign betrifft. FÃ¼r echte Fans von Retro-Strategiespielen, die einfach mal eine andere Herausforderung suchen, kÃ¶nnte das Spiel dennoch etwas sein,...vor allem das Management der saudummen KI, auf die man wie auf ein Baby aufpassen muss,...

author: {'steamid': '76561198062251443', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1530550876}
review: An old RTS game for those who are into WWII or a history buff or simply loves tanks, infantry, all the fun stuff. The tutorial was a bit hard especially for the Wehrmacht campaign where I literally lost half my tanks and infantry and my Tiger II when you started the mission. Half the time I can't tell if my infantry are actually shooting. I also tried Skrimish and for some reason even with an ally it took like 30 seconds for a victory to point where I didn't even earn money to build units. But hey I love the foil and the level 3 badge which matches my profile picture and I love the Wehrmacht emote so that's a plus. Graphics aren't great but then again it's an old game so what do you really expect. I like it but I rather recommend Men At War, Company of Heroes, or another RTS WWII game if you want something more familar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172424262', 'num_games_owned': 174, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1535753838}
review: Es un buen juego de estrategia, al estilo Comand and Conquer. Viene en ingles, pero es facil su manejo. Para un juego del aÃ±o 2002, esta muy bien y que se puede jugar en window 7, 8 y 10, es una maravilla. Editado por la compaÃ±ia alemana Topware, de la que tambien he jugado otros juegos de la saga Earth 2140, 2160, etc. que son una maravilla jugarlos. World War II: Panzer Claws no necesita un ordenador muy potente, necesita poca memoria. Solo he jugado en skirmish y con el bando aleman, para hecerme con los controles y ver las unidades. Estan representadas casi todas (Panzer III, IV, Panther, Tiger, Kingtiger, Sd.Kfz 222, Ostwind, Hummel, etc..) , Tambien Flak antiaereos, antitanques, bunquer, etc.. para el amante de la Segunda Guerra Mundial es una gozada. Tantos juegos matamata al estilo Counter Strike, Call of Duty, me aburre. Pon un poco de estrategia en tus juegos. prueba este, pero solo si te va la estrategia en tiempo real, al estilo C&C, lo recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1513587094}
review:
Tags: Tactical - Squad & Military
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

In a nutshell: Outdated mostly unusable experience with unreadable tooltips popping over everything, a clunky ammo resupply, slow drudging missions, overcomplicated user interface, antiquated resolution options and an annoying CD-KEY drm that keeps inserting spacebars randomly having you re-type cd key sections over and over again. Seems to mostly obey RTS conventions. Not worth the HDD space, not worth the time, not worth the library clutter. DRM limits you to 5 installs but you will be done 5 minutes after your first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041694207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1483456098}
review:
This is the hollow husk of what once was a great game. While I may not have many hours listed here on steam, I have hundreds of hours on the ORIGINAL variant of this game on CD. 

This game origanly came out under the name of- "Frontline Attack: War over Europe"

The game core is the same, but stripped to the bare bones. The engine and mechanics are the same, but the game has been weakened. With the exclusion of the French Ristance campagin, the original 3 are the same.

Originaly, the Skirmish mode had a HUGE base builidng aspect, in this variant all it has are 3/4 core base buildings which simply unlock the air support abilities. Moreover, the cost of unit's have radically changed.




In summary, this game has great potentical- but only if you find the ORIGINAL variant under "Frontline Attack- War over Europe"

review:
I will try to express how i felt in the game in long story short.
The games rating is i have to say 9/10  and i RECCOMEND the game on any time the price is good for such a good game!

Pros:
+Its fun in multiple ways
+Reminds the old day games with these kinda graphics and i like it!
+Has a pretty good story
+Has story mode,ofline mod, multiplayer mode
+it used to be one of the best games out there and still is super fun.

Cons:
-No cards?

Overall: The game is super fun if your into Strategy games and old type of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11095, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1515790951}
review:
Warning:  No graphics support for modern systems, the game is 14 years old and has not been maintained properly.

But the developers did make the effort to port it to OSX as a cheerful desperate cash grab, so they certainly are still around, with their hands out for money.

Okay, so what's wrong with this game?   The graphics is first.  I'll put up with an old game having old looking graphics, but there's no widescreen support and there's no support for modern resolutions (or even ancient resolutions like 1080P HD!) 

Gameplay is equally woeful - it plays worse than older C&C/Red Alert games!  It's dry and uninteresting.

So, lack of modernisation, poor gameplay, and insulting behavior from the publishers give this one a solid thumbs down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088829328', 'num_games_owned': 2962, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1476359278}
review:
The kind of (very old), game you`d expect to see on a sinclair ZX80 with graphics to match.
Don`t pay more than a pound for it.

And don`t expect it to look like whats in the store pages video clip, (or the stills for that matter). 

The actual game sort of vaguely resembles them, but the clip & pictures employ a lot of "artistic licence" and are very misleading. 

They don`t match the gameplay.

Look at a Youtube Gameplay before you decide.

review:
World War II: Panzer Claws 

DescripciÃ³n

TopWare trae un nuevo tÃ­tulo de estrategia en tiempo real que lleva la Segunda Guerra Mundial hasta cotas muy altas. En el aÃ±o 1940, Francia se acercÃ³ al lado mÃ¡s oscuro de la guerra. Durante todo ese tiempo, el gobierno francÃ©s formÃ³ una colaboraciÃ³n como aliada y estando bajo el control de todos los enemigos y las resistencias. 

Se dispondrÃ¡n de tres facciones: los alemanes, los rusos y los aliados; los cuÃ¡les tomarÃ¡n las calles y los campos de batalla con todo tipo de vehÃ­culos para hacer frente al enemigo. La principal misiÃ³n serÃ¡ escoger cada uno de estos bandos y lograr la victoria.

Acerca de este juego

[WORLD WAR II: PANZER CLAWS [aka Frontline Attack: War over Europe] pushes back the boundaries of real-time strategy gaming! 
Take control of the Allied, German, or the Russian in the harsh reality of the battlefields of World War II. At your disposal are a vast number of vehicles and tanks, as well as ground troops and the ability to call in air forces when needed. All these elements must be used in order to obtain the ultimate prize: Victory! 

PANZER CLAWS II:
In 1940, France fell beneath the dark tide of war. During the early days of the occupation, the French government capitulated, and formed a collaborationist state. While the country was under enemy control, resistance fighters took to the hills, and back alleys. These brave souls began mobilizing for a fight against their occupiers, and mis-directed government officials. 
Panzer Claws II offer the player the choice between one of the four sides in the conflicts: the Germans, the Russians or the Allies and the French Resistance. 

Includes both parts: Panzer Claws I + II!

FEATURES:
3D maps enhance the gameplay experience 
Four campaigns with over 40 missions on the four sides in the conflicts: the Germans, the Russians or the Allies and the French Resistance. 
True to history, the campaign missions take place in various seasons of the year, greatly affecting your strategies 
True real-time: night and day will occur during your missions, changing light and visibility 
15 extra missions to play in Skirmish mode, 8-player Multiplayer over LAN and EarthNetâ„¢ 
The easy-to-use editor allows you to create your own missions to play single-player or multiplayer

review:
Ce jeu Ã©tait le trÃ¨s bon jeu de RTS. TrÃ¨s intÃ©ressant sur le plan historique avec des missions reflÃ©tant les Ã©venements de la 2nd Guerre Mondiale. Il reste nÃ©anmoins un jeu de 2004 oubliÃ© aujourd'hui, avec ces caractÃ©ristiques comme l'utilisation de troupe d'Ã©lite, d'avion bombardier et reconnaissance ainsi qu'une bonne tripotÃ© de chars! Sa reste un bon p'ti jeu complet 'vintage' qui peu Ãªtre encore jouer par les amateurs de stratÃ©gie et de WW II, (mÃªme si les graphismes ne sont plus au goÃ»t du jour). Il dispose quand mÃªme d'une bande son et traduction en FranÃ§ais (se qui est bien pratique pour apprendre les bases du jeu) et selon l'Ã©quipe jouer il y aura des jurons ou des paroles dans leur languages (Allemands / Russes...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002158652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1445756123}
review:
If you expect epic tank battles and battles alike: Don't buy this game. After a few minutes in the game I was alerady bored by the mediocre graphics and animations. Controls feel a bit clunky and movement-speed of units seem way off. Since when are infrantry crawling faster than a Panzer IV? Another thing I disliked was the limitations to the parts of the battlefield that you were able to see. 

To mention something good: Tanks actually have ammunition and once you run dry of ammo you'll need to order a halftrack to come fill you up. 

Would I recommend this game? A clear NO.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986294711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1661588596}
review:
Panzer Claws I&2
 
 This game included Panzer Claws 1 and 2, not sure how that works, the two games might be merged somehow because I did not see a separate menu for each.
 
It is a crude graphically  by 2015 standards but in other ways completely polished. 

 
-- It has pause, and orders can be given  to your units.
-- It has a time adjustment slider so you can play the action leisure laggardly or fiercely fast.
Yes some modern "RTS" games just do not have these features anymore and I avoid them like the plague.  

Good music.

There are a wide range of units and  each have their own particular use in the rock paper scissors scheme.
At this time I have not played any missions, just skirmish.  I do not know what it is about these games all the way from Age of Empires 1 to Company of Heroes 2.  For some reason the skirmish against the AI is what I play more than the missions. 

It is odd though, in skirmish game I played, the King Tiger is cheaper than the Tiger 1 and after the first battle battle,  the enemy 2nd wave included a  JS 3 tank on the Russian side!  My pzIIIs scattered!  At theis time I'm playing meduim difficulty.

2nd skirmish with an AI ally and a T34/85 is in the 2nd wave attack.  The AI stole my initial recon vehicle! They killed the crew in the initial exploration attack and crewed it before I could send guys up there to man it!

Also the supply, if one calls for supply to  top off their tank and then moves  that tank, it seems the supply truck goes to the first set of coordinates to drop the load, so I had to learn to move ammo dumps closer and not confuse the supply truck by not moving my  tank after calling for it.  Also it seems the supply truck will auto supply units after ammo levels drop past a certain point.

Vehicles can be captured, an enemy armed car was abandoned and I took that, and the AI got even by snagging a motorcycle I lost and could not recrew. 

The best part I liked about this game is calling airstrikes.  It seems easier to understand and more satisfying than say Company of Heroes.  Maybe it is the scale of the map and sprites, anyway click on an airplane then target and the airplane in a few seconds will fly over to it and drop its bomb.  If it strikes generally that vehicle is KaBOOM dead.  If the tank moves in the meantime though, it seems the plane will drop its bomb at the spot it was, it may not follow the tank or drop it on a neighbor.  If one can save enough money, a good carpetbomb airstrike with heavy bombers (He-111's on the German side) will really mess up an enemy blob.

Runs fine on
Windows 8.1 64bit (bootcamp)
2012 Imac 27"
8 gigoRAM
GTX 680 MX

author: {'steamid': '76561198131505860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1444872343}
review:
Honestly, I played this game for about 40 minutes. This game is neat, but in no means a good game. 

This game has major flaws and problems. When I played it, I felt that I both loved it and hated it.
So Imma gonna start out with da good stuffs!

The effects- I love these effects, They kinda remind me of golden eye 64. After a devastating explosion there is fire and smoke everywhere, and I LOVE IT. So good destructive effects give me the feeling of the real chaos or devestation of a battleground. BUT, these effects go away like all good games have them do. I really do like fires on a battle field or smoke always lingering. I dunno, that's just me. The thing that gets me that you can have an entire area get blown up, but when you look back it's all gone and the landscape is back to normal! It might have been system or budget limitations so I dunno. Not an expert on de subject. 

The idea- This game does kind of remind me of C&C Red Alert. You gain resources by garrisoning factories, mines, and some other stuff. I like what this game tries to do, I think it is pretty neat. In another sense it reminds me of Company of Heroes. Why? Because IST WW2. Am I gonna expand on that? Nawp.

The units- These units are both pretty cool and completely useless. FOR EXAMPLE. The infantry. The infantry serve one purpose and one purpose only. TO COUNTER OTHER INFANTRY!!! Here is the catch. This game makes you use infantry as you would in a real military strategy. Seeing in further detail how NONE OF THE TANKS HAVE MACHINE GUNS. It might be a blessing in disguise. Alot of RTS games allow you to defeat your enemies with tanks and armor alone. This game does not give tanks or vehicles a machine gun that has a cannon as it's main weapon. IT MAKE NO SENSE. Maybe it does, I dunno. But here is the thing, Tanks are massive mobile killing platforms. As with many advantages, there comes with some disadvantages. Tanks, (Especially in WW2) were very clunky and primitive in the sense of infantry protection. The germans tried many things to keep rockets, grenade, and mines from destroying the hull of their heavy expensive tanks. They do have these units in game, such as mine clearing tanks, tanks with balistic plating only used on later german tanks, and self propelled guns. They are all usefull in their own ways. But when you are in a cramped steel killing machine with only so many ways to figure out what is happening outside of the tank and infantry can easily sneak up behind or beside a tank and easily destroy it. They use infantry to fill in the gaps. That is what this game tries to emulate, but it is done poorly to the point when all my infantry is dead or being distracted by some enemy units. MY TANKS ARE DEFENSELESS. Of course they will turn to attack in turn, but the tank shells do pitiful damage. WHEH?! I dont get why tank shells dont do more damage. The same thing with tanks. The king tiger on the training level that you get, gets to attack about 3 T34-76's. Each taking about five shells, maybe even more. I feel that in a real scenario, A tiger would eleminate all of them if they had a fair set of distance between eachother. The duels between two tanks dont really feel like fights of skill or determination or even superiority, but as to my suprise, they are just slugging matches. The fire at eachother until someone wins game. DRUNKEN BRAWLS ALL ROUND. I think I has made my point.

Welp, I think that is all the somewhat good things I have to say about this game. NOW LETS GET TO THE BAD.

The animation- honestly, graphics, not a problem with me. Models? Good looking models do help with the over all game.
Animation? Yes. Animation is a must. Without animation the game feels lifeless and empty, but in a game like this, animation is not needed to be as crucial or prioritized in an RTS game. In games like action games, RPG's, shooters, fighting games, sports, or anything else for that matter. In first person shooters you need to know if your character is reloading his weapon. So, as it would occur, you hit X or R if you will see a reloading animation. Is kinda hard to figure out if ya character is reloadin his gun if you cant tell if he is or not on the screen. In this game, animation is minimal. Is this a bad thing? Nah. But is it a good thing? Never. Without animation in video games, you lack the feeling of impact or explanation. This is what happens in this game. Especially the infantry, *Shudders* the infantry... The infantry move WAY TO FAST, and that animation does not match that speed. You know that there is a great game called Blitzkrieg. I am gonna talk about the first one. Maybe because it is the best one in my opinion and it felt like the most strategic of the series. The infantry in that game moved incredibly slow, which in turn encourages you to use mechanized vehicles to transport your infantry. In this game. There is infantry carriers in this game, but they in turn are unbelievably weak and cannot even hold a full team of infantry. SO WAS DA POINT. In addition the soldiers felt more like robots than humans...

The maps- This game has alot of maps. A suprising amount of neat maps I might add. Here is the catch with this one. Alot of these maps dont apply to the way the units in this game move. There are alot of mountains in this game, and the path finding in this game makes all the units hug the walls. I dont know why? It's not the shortest route, it's just plain stupid.

The AI- This AI might be aware of the state of their insecurities and immediatily wish to declare a truce on the battlefield. I am not kidding. Other than that, the AI is pretty standard.

The UI- This is in no doubt what ruins this game for me. The User Interface on this game is despicable. Every thing feels clunky and unfinished or rushed. The UI feels more user hostile than friendly. It doesnt lighten up the fact that a certain other thing I hate about this game. The map doesnt make sense either. How your units are represented on the map is very difficult and impractical to me. I would continue but then I would have to do the next point so here we go.

The camera- Now that I think about it. This camera is the worst thing about this game. There is some options for this stupid camera, but I dont think it helps out alot. The camera is really hard to explain. When you rotate the camera by holding down the mouse button. The camera moves, but not the map direction. If you have had experience with RTS games. There is a normal white square or something along those lines on the map that indicate what direction the map is facing and what you can see from both perspectives. Of course this game does it, but poorly. It isnt done by the white rectangle but by the way you are facing the map will get brighter from what you see. This does help in some cases, but a few of these maps are in the snow. AND THAT DONT HELP MEH. Now, to get where I am coming from. You have to understand how to play a RTS. How I like to control my forces is from the highest view possible as from a bird's eye perspective. Well, this camera pans straight down. I no like. I dont feel like it is preference, but when the camera pans down the I cant see what I want my troops to attack or advance too. Here is another thing. The camera doesnt feel free. It doesnt feel like it wants to cooperate at all times, like it should. When the enemy attacks me, I want to jump to the place on the map that the enemy is attacking. Combined with the bad camera, hard to use UI, and everything else cluttering ontop of your game. IST NAGHT FUN. 

But I digress. There is tons of things that I could say. It might have been lack of budget or system limitations. Here is where the game gets me. I like the effects... 

Effects+
Idea+
Units+
A bunch of cool little things+
Animation-
Maps-
Ui-
Camera-
Ai-
A bunch of other things-

In the end. This game is normally on sale. It is dated fun of some kind. I have had plenty. GOOD DAY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080117781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1593803327}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198035752813', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1427505068}
review:
This game is amazing, even after a decade of existance. While not very appealing visually, the gameplay is fun and solid. The tanks operate off of an armor basis. As in all but the lightest vehicles cannot be harmed by small arms. Tanks with lighter armor will suffer much more damage from tank shells than a tank with heavy armor.

The amount of units surprised me, as there are almost a dozen different infantry squads, as well as almost two dozen tanks and armored vehicles for each side (excluding the French Resistance). You can also realistically build up your base of operations with MG nests, AT bunkers and more.

I sometimes question if the enemy AI are actually trying to kill me or just exploring and happen to find my base, but then again, it's very advanced for 2004.

Finally, you have the ability to call in aerial reconnaissance, a light bombing strike, or even carpet bombing. There's even stuctures and vehicles that can counter these strikes.

Overall, I still find that this game can fit well in modern games aside from the graphics.
Definately buy this if you have the spare cash.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049696509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1709910292}
review:
This game is so utterly non-strategic and its mechanics are so unrealistic and dumb that it's simply beautiful. Perfect if you want to have a small, not too engaging game that wishes it was a real RTS when it grows up.

For instance - everything in the game has auto-aim so they always hit if the target is within range, so if you battle a tank of the same class as yours then it's basically a quickdraw contest of who shot first, then watch for a few seconds before the loser explodes.
The infantry in the game had to be somehow balanced not to be utterly useless so they did that by making them absolutely immune to tank shells, even if they score a direct headshot with one; they can only be killed with a machine gun, which is also an excuse why a machine gun even exists in the game (there are no trenches or any strategy, infantry is ALWAYS in the open).
You can also call in an airstrike in the game but that's also balanced by making the bombs dropped by the planes have just about the same impact as a loud fart.
There is no recon/stealth mechanics so if the enemy is within your shooting range it means they can see you the moment you open fire.
Each nation has basically one super tank that is basically the ultimate doom machine and there is honestly little to no point in investing in anything else, so you can just spam those. It has absolutely no disadvantages, other than the slow speed (but you're not in a hurry anywhere), and the enemy can only make a scratch in its armor if they have a tank with a similar class of a caliber (so either they also get the doom tank or some other out of the very few ones that can make a dent in its armor, only to quickly realise they wasted money because their own armor is s**t).
Due to having to build a base near one of the few spawn points scattered around the map the enemy ALWAYS knows where you start the game and where your base is (even if you capture another spawn point others can just see it anyway).
There's one unbalanced situation where each nation has a supertank for $15k, but the Germans have one more tank with EXACTLY the same stats and much cheaper.

Still, I love this game. <3
